column4: hey does anyone know why my ubuntu machine might not be able to resolve my windows machine name anymore?
seems like just a "local" dns thing... I mean... I can get to freenode...
seems like just windows names though... is there a service for that?
depends what you configured it to use
did you tell it to join a domain for example
for some reason I think it needs to run nmbd... does that make sense?
k... I'm not sure how to do that ... just typing nmbd doesn't seem to change anything
there's no nmbd script in there
yeah... no error... should I be running the samba script from /etc/init.d ?
any idea how to test if it's running?
looks like it's running... it still has the old IP for my windows machine though
is there a way to flush dns on linux (I imagine there is)
some interesting options in the man page http://optics.ph.unimelb.edu.au/help/samba/nmbd.8.html
